alert.note: Alert for Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 5:46AM PST until March 02 at 4:41PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County. Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County. .Flooding continues or is forecast for both the Satsop and Skookumchuck rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 213.0 feet, the Skookumchuck River in Thurston County will flood several residential and business areas around Bucoda. Flood waters will cover many roads * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 209.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 213.8 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 211.5 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 915 AM PST.
